intro: Centranthus calcitrapae f. roseus, commonly known as the rose-centranthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features finely divided, silver-gray foliage that adds ornamental value throughout the growing season. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions. Due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
